notesStmt.note: Small surface abrasions, especially over folds, and delamination. Some pleats and cockling. Minor water damage; small area of salt accretion and a few stains at edges. Slight worming at one join. Mantle damaged and fragile.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 75 membranes, with wooden rollers. Silk mantle.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square script of the 14th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Bought by the British Museum, using the Bridgewater fund (£12,000 bequeathed in 1829 by Francis Henry Egerton, 8th Earl of Bridgewater (b. 1756, d. 1829).
